results.title: Bezhin Meadow = Bezhin Lug
results.brief_description: Introduced in English. Eisenstein’s “Bezhin Meadow” was to be a drama set against the background of collectivisation of agriculture and based on the true story of Pavlick Morosov, a little boy who organised his fellow pioneers to guard the harvest so effectively that his own Kulak family, planning sabotage, felt him an enemy of his class and killed him. The result can only be a shadow; but this 1966 half hour reconstruction has a force which makes one regret bitterly what must have been Eisenstein’s finest film. From a story by Ivan Turgenev.

The result can only be a shadow; but this 1966 half hour reconstruction has a force which makes one regret bitterly what must have been Eisenstein’s finest film. From a story by Ivan Turgenev.

results.title: Beyond words: animal communication
results.creator_credit: Wolfgang Bayer, National Geographic Society and Wolfgang Bayer Productions
results.brief_description: Provides an overview of animals communicating for various reasons. Examples of calls and other communications amongst animals are then catalogued. Teachers guide included. Suitable for lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: Beyond the wall
results.creator_credit: Ronald Branscombe and Nomad Films International
results.brief_description: Takes a look at the semi-nomadic herding economy of the people of inner Mongolia whom still mantain their ancient culture despite the intrusion of the modern world. Shows the division of labour, the importance of the horse to the community and the men’s superb horsemanship, constant search for water, types of food eaten and the traditional customs followed at a marriage ceremony. Also notes how the introduction of regular schooling and health care improved general standards of living and young people living an urban lifestyle unknown to their parents.

results.title: Beyond the volta
results.creator_credit: Enoch Vander Pule and Gold Coast Film Unit
results.brief_description: Discusses the economic and political progress of a region in West Africa now known as Trans-Volta Togoland. Points out that once local government was set up, steps were taken to provide the region with a system of roads and bridges, and adequate water supply and hospitals and clinics to help in the fight against leprosy and other diseases prevelant in tropical countries. Advances in industrial and agricultural fields were also made; these included re-establishment of the palm oil industry and the introduction of modern methods and machinery. Progress is being made in the educational field by the establishment of technical colleges and universities.

results.title: Beyond the tooth of time
results.brief_description: American teenage scouts visit Philmont Scout Ranch in Texas. In rugged beautiful natural surroundings they enjoy rough trail hiking, camping, shooting, fishing, archery, cattle work, forestry, riding and learn about rocks, gold and the early history of the area. The twenty-one camps in the ranch provide these boys with a taste for life in the wilderness as it was lived by early American pioneers. No credits available.

results.title: Beyond the shadows
results.creator_credit: Stan Phillips and Western Cine Productions
results.brief_description: The problems of mental retardation. How, through self-initiated effort, the people of Colorado Springs took steps to overcome their fears and prejudices against the mentally retarded and united in a programme to help provide health, welfare, educational and evaluation services to the handicapped.

results.title: Beyond the roaring forties
results.creator_credit: Conon Fraser, Derek Wright and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description: Shows the Natural History of New Zealand’s subantartic islands. New Zealand’s subantartic Islands of “The Snares”, Auckland Island, Campbell Island, Bounty Island, Macquarie Island and Antipodes Island house unique species of birds and marine mammals. These rarely visited islands are under the auspice of the Royal New Zealand Navy who are carefully observing and measuring the geological, geographical, isoseismal changes and are maintaining vital observations of wildlife and vegetation patterns. Narrated by Ray Henwood.

results.title: Beyond the border crossing
results.creator_credit: Ted Davis and Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture
results.brief_description: States in the north of Australia are the home of the Queensland Fruit Fly, the predator which each year can destroy million of dollars worth of fruit and vegetables. Shows the precautions which are taken to keep the fruit fly out of Victoria and the methods used to control it once it is discovered. Stresses the need for the co-operation of every traveller entering Victoria by land, sea or air. Photography by Ted Davis. Narrated by Terry McDermott.
